availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Adam C. Keenon (Frankfort, Kentucky, book binder)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, book binder. Paris, Kentucky, native. Married to Elizabeth Clark Keenon in 1823. Father of Irene Keenon, Zenada Kennon, and Rosalyn Kennon. First Public Binder of Kentucky in 1822. Book binder in Frankfort from 1822 to 1867. Member of the Masonic Order in Frankfort, Kentucky.

bibl.p: "Death of Mr. A. C. Keenon," The Frankfort Roundabout (Frankfort, Ky.), March 31, 1883; The Frankfort Roundabout (Frankfort, Ky.), May 14, 1904, p. 8; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, Court House, p. 2; Find A Grave, "Adam Calderwood Keenon (1799-1883)," Memorial #97622975, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=97622975&ref=acom (accessed May 5, 2017).
